location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'MAP OF UNDEMARCATED PORTION OF PERSO-AFGHAN FRONTIER'

physicalDescription.extent: Materials: printed on paperDimensions: 1780 x 940 mmFoliation: the map has been foliated with a number written in pencil enclosed in a circle in the top right corner of the recto side of the folio.

mods.abstract: Map of the undemarcated portion of the frontier between Persia and Afghanistan, north of the frontier agreed by the Seistan [Sīstān] Arbitration Mission in 1905, compiled by Captain Terence Humphrey Keyes, His Britannic Majesty's Consul, Turbat-i-Haidari. The map was compiled from the Seistan Arbitration Mission Map, sheet 2; two other trans-frontier sheets; and reconnaissance in March and April 1906.Imprint: 'I. B. [Intelligence Branch] Topo. Dy. No. 6,352. Exd. C.J.A.'Distinctive features: signed by Captain Terence Humphrey Keyes, His Britannic Majesty's Consul, Turbat-i-Haidari, 18 May 1906; shows inhabited places; watering places; 'Places about which I have no information'; Russian Quarantine Posts; Belgian Customs Posts; new Afghan fortified posts; telegraph line; and the Perso-Afghan frontier (demarcated; undemarcated, according to Indian Maps; and actual possession in spring of 1906).
